design:
Intent: Provide Windows-native multi-project discovery using registry + scanner with safe defaults; never scan full drives unless explicitly requested.

Decisions:
- Scan roots: %USERPROFILE% + registry entries; optional full-drive mode adds C:\ and D:\ only when mode=full-drive.
- Bounded recursion (default maxDepth=6) and ignore list to protect performance.
- Normalize paths with canonicalizeWindowsPath/windowsPathKey; dedupe by key.
- API contract: GET /api/scan?mode=default|full-drive&depth=<int> returns { mode, roots, projects, stats }.

Edge cases:
- Missing/unreadable directories are skipped (ENOENT/ENOTDIR/EACCES/EPERM) without aborting scan.
- Invalid mode/depth returns 400.

Windows constraints:
- Use drive-letter paths only; no Unix assumptions.

Testing:
- scanner.test.ts covers default roots, full-drive roots, ignore list, and depth limits.
- npm test to verify.

Non-goals:
- No background watcher or SSE here.
- No default full-drive scan.
acceptance_criteria: A written execution-grade plan exists for this epic and all child task descriptions are updated with concrete implementation details, dependencies, and testable acceptance criteria.
close_reason: Captured scanner design/contract and verification plan.

title: Parse dependency edges and build adjacency structures
description:
Build graph data preparation pipeline for dependency workspace.

Scope:
- Input: parsed Bead issues from read layer only (`readIssuesFromDisk`).
- Build normalized node map keyed by issue id.
- Build typed edge list from `dependencies[]` supporting: blocks, parent, relates_to, duplicates, supersedes.
- Include reverse index (incoming/outgoing) to support focus queries.
- Preserve issue metadata needed by UI nodes: id, title, status, priority, issue_type, assignee, updated_at.

Rules:
- Ignore dependency edges that point to missing issue IDs but record count for diagnostics.
- Deduplicate duplicate edges (same source, target, type).
- Treat path/project context as explicit API argument for future multi-project support.
- Do not mutate source issues.

Output contracts:
- `GraphModel = { nodes, edges, adjacency, diagnostics }`
- `adjacency` includes incoming/outgoing arrays per node.
- `diagnostics` includes counts for missing targets and dropped duplicates.

Test plan:
- Unit tests for edge extraction across all supported types.
- Unit tests for dedupe and missing-target behavior.
- Unit tests for adjacency correctness and deterministic ordering.
acceptance_criteria:
- Graph model contains all valid nodes and typed edges from issue dependencies.
- Duplicate edges are removed deterministically.
- Missing-target edges do not crash model generation and are surfaced in diagnostics.
- Adjacency maps are correct for incoming/outgoing lookups.
- Unit tests cover all supported dependency types and edge cases.

title: Live File Watching and SSE Transport
description:
Realtime transport epic to deliver deterministic file-change propagation from .beads/issues.jsonl(.new) into the Kanban UI.

Scope boundaries:
- Read source remains disk JSONL via read-issues; no bd CLI reads.
- Mutation/write path remains bd.exe only (already implemented in bb-ymg).
- This epic adds one-way change detection + push invalidation, not business-rule mutation logic.

Implementation contract:
1) Watch manager (`src/lib/watcher.ts`)
- Uses chokidar to monitor `<projectRoot>/.beads/issues.jsonl` and `.beads/issues.jsonl.new`.
- Normalizes project roots with existing Windows path helpers.
- Supports start/stop per project and global cleanup for tests/dev reloads.
- Emits typed change events with monotonic event ids and timestamps.

2) Burst and lock stability (`bb-tpc.2`)
- Debounce/coalesce rapid write bursts into one logical event per project window.
- Treat transient lock/read contention as retryable (EBUSY/EPERM) in read path.

3) SSE server (`src/app/api/events/route.ts`)
- `text/event-stream` endpoint with heartbeat and `id:` fields.
- Optional `projectRoot` filter for scoped subscribers.
- Cleans up subscriptions and timers on disconnect.

4) Frontend subscriber (`bb-tpc.4`)
- EventSource client reconnect behavior handled by browser defaults.
- On event, re-fetch affected project issues and reconcile local state.
- No direct JSONL polling loops after SSE is active.

Non-goals in this epic:
- WebSocket transport.
- Cross-process durable event bus.
- React Query migration (deferred; current lane keeps existing local fetch/reconcile pattern).
acceptance_criteria:
- Editing `.beads/issues.jsonl` externally triggers UI refresh in <1s without manual reload.
- SSE stream remains connected with periodic heartbeat; reconnect path resumes safely.
- Event stream and watcher code use Windows-safe path normalization.
- No direct JSONL writes introduced (guard still passes).
- `npm run typecheck`, `npm run test`, `npm run dev` pass.
notes: Decoupled bb-tpc baseline from scanner epic: current implementation is project-scoped via query projectRoot and does not require registry integration. Multi-project watcher orchestration remains under scanner follow-up tasks.
close_reason: Completed watcher/SSE tracer end-to-end for project-scoped realtime updates with tests and smoke checks.

title: Implement chokidar watch manager for registered projects
description:
Implement `src/lib/watcher.ts` watch manager for project-scoped issue files.

Scope:
- Watch both `<projectRoot>/.beads/issues.jsonl` and `<projectRoot>/.beads/issues.jsonl.new`.
- Support startWatch(projectRoot), stopWatch(projectRoot), stopAll().
- Ensure idempotent start behavior (no duplicate watchers for same canonical root).
- Emit typed events into in-process realtime bus with:
  - id (monotonic)
  - projectRoot (canonical path)
  - kind (changed|renamed)
  - path
  - at (ISO timestamp)

Implementation notes:
- chokidar with `ignoreInitial: true` and Windows-safe normalized paths.
- Maintain internal map keyed by windowsPathKey(projectRoot).
- Route event -> coalescer (bb-tpc.2), not direct SSE writes.

Test plan:
- Unit tests verify idempotent lifecycle and key normalization behavior.
- Unit tests verify events from both jsonl candidates are accepted.
acceptance_criteria:
- Starting watch for same project twice creates one active watcher.
- Stopping watch removes watcher and prevents further events.
- Events include canonical project root and unique monotonic event id.
- Watch target includes both `.beads/issues.jsonl` and `.beads/issues.jsonl.new`.
notes: Implemented src/lib/watcher.ts with chokidar manager, idempotent start/stop lifecycle, windowsPathKey normalization, and dual-file watch targets (.jsonl + .jsonl.new). Added tests/lib/watcher.test.ts.
close_reason: Watcher lifecycle manager implemented with canonical project scoping and tested watch behavior.

title: Add debounce/coalescing and transient lock handling for file change bursts
description:
Implement debounce/coalescing + transient lock resilience for realtime updates.

Scope:
- Coalesce rapid filesystem bursts into a single logical change event per project in a short window (e.g. 100-250ms).
- Suppress duplicate events for same project/path within the same window.
- Handle transient file lock contention in read layer with bounded retry for EBUSY/EPERM before surfacing failure.

Integration points:
- Coalescer sits between watcher and SSE broadcaster.
- Read retry applied in `readIssuesFromDisk` path used by UI reconciliation.

Test plan:
- Unit tests for coalescer burst behavior (N events => 1 broadcast).
- Unit tests for lock retry logic and eventual success/failure behavior.
acceptance_criteria:
- Burst writes within debounce window produce one emitted project event.
- Distinct project events are not incorrectly merged.
- Transient EBUSY/EPERM reads are retried with bounded backoff.
- Permanent read errors still surface as explicit failures.
notes: Implemented src/lib/coalescer.ts for burst event coalescing and integrated in watcher manager. Added src/lib/read-text-retry.ts and wired readIssuesFromDisk to retry transient lock errors (EBUSY/EPERM). Added tests/lib/coalescer.test.ts and tests/lib/read-text-retry.test.ts.
close_reason: Burst coalescing and transient lock retry behavior implemented and covered by tests.

title: Implement SSE events API endpoint with heartbeat and event IDs
description:
Implement SSE endpoint at `src/app/api/events/route.ts` backed by in-process event bus.

Scope:
- Response headers: `Content-Type: text/event-stream`, `Cache-Control: no-cache, no-transform`, `Connection: keep-alive`.
- Emit named events (`event: issues`) with `id:` and JSON payload.
- Heartbeat comments at fixed cadence to keep intermediaries alive.
- Support optional `projectRoot` query filter so client receives only scoped updates.
- Cleanup subscriber + heartbeat resources on request abort.

Event payload contract:
{
  id: number,
  projectRoot: string,
  changedPath?: string,
  at: string
}

Test plan:
- Unit tests for SSE formatting helper and filter matching.
- Route-level test ensures proper content-type and streaming status.
acceptance_criteria:
- SSE endpoint responds with valid event-stream headers.
- Each issue update includes event id + timestamp payload.
- Subscriber cleanup occurs on disconnect without leaks.
- Project filter limits event delivery to matching subscribers.
notes: Implemented SSE route at src/app/api/events/route.ts with event-stream headers, connected frame, heartbeats, issue event frames, projectRoot filtering via bus subscription, and cleanup on abort/cancel. Added tests/api/events-route.test.ts + tests/lib/realtime.test.ts.
close_reason: SSE transport endpoint implemented with heartbeat/id frames and lifecycle cleanup.

title: CLI Write-Back via bd.exe
description:
Write-back architecture for BeadBoard.

Scope:
- All issue mutations must execute through bd.exe commands.
- No direct writes to .beads/issues.jsonl are permitted anywhere in app code.
- Mutation flow includes create/update/close/reopen/comment.

Design decisions:
- Process execution uses child_process.execFile with arg arrays (no shell interpolation).
- Commands run with project-scoped cwd so each request targets the intended repo.
- Executable resolution supports explicit configured path and PATH fallback.
- API responses are normalized with stable ok/error shape for frontend and tests.
- UI writeback uses optimistic updates with rollback and authoritative re-read.

Implemented artifacts:
- src/lib/bd-path.ts
- src/lib/bridge.ts
- src/lib/mutations.ts
- src/app/api/beads/{create,update,close,reopen,comment}/route.ts
- src/app/api/beads/read/route.ts
- src/lib/writeback.ts
- Kanban drag-and-drop transition wiring in components.
acceptance_criteria:
Acceptance contract:
1) Source tree has no direct issues.jsonl write path (guard test passes).
2) Bridge returns structured command result including classification for timeout/not_found/non_zero_exit/bad_args.
3) Mutation routes validate payloads and map operations to bd commands.
4) Reopen and comment flows are supported and verified.
5) Optimistic status updates rollback on failure and reconcile from authoritative read endpoint.
6) typecheck + test + dev + mutation smoke lifecycle all pass.
close_reason: Write-back epic unblocked and complete: bridge, mutation API, optimistic transitions, and drag/drop flows are implemented and verified.

title: Implement bd bridge using child_process.execFile with project-scoped cwd
description:
Bridge layer requirements and implementation.

Command execution contract:
- Uses execFile(command, args, options) with windowsHide and timeout.
- Uses projectRoot as cwd for all commands.
- Returns structured payload: success, classification, command, args, cwd, stdout, stderr, code, durationMs, error.

Error model:
- not_found: executable missing / ENOENT.
- timeout: ETIMEDOUT, killed process, or SIGTERM timeout path.
- bad_args: non-zero exits with invalid/unknown/usage style stderr.
- non_zero_exit: non-zero exits not classified as bad_args.
- unknown: fallback classification.

Verification:
- tests/lib/bridge.test.ts covers success and all key failure classes.
acceptance_criteria:
Acceptance contract:
- Bridge command execution is shell-safe and Windows-path-safe.
- Structured result schema is stable and consumed by mutation layer.
- Timeout and failure classes are deterministic under test.
notes: Implemented src/lib/bridge.ts with execFile-based bd runner, project-scoped cwd, timeout support, structured command result payload, and failure classification (not_found, timeout, bad_args, non_zero_exit, unknown). Added RED->GREEN tests in tests/lib/bridge.test.ts.
close_reason: Bridge implemented with structured result/error classification and project-scoped execFile command execution; tests added.

title: Resolve bd.exe location from PATH and configuration fallback
description:
Executable resolution contract.

Resolution order:
1) explicit configured executable path (request/config)
2) PATH scan for bd.exe, bd.cmd, bd.bat, bd

Failure behavior:
- Throw actionable guidance when missing, including install command:
  npm install -g @beads/bd
- Error message explicitly mentions explicit path when provided but invalid.

Verification:
- tests/lib/bd-path.test.ts validates config-first behavior, PATH lookup, and missing executable guidance.
acceptance_criteria:
Acceptance contract:
- Resolver is deterministic for config and PATH inputs.
- Missing executable guidance is actionable and user-readable.
notes: Implemented src/lib/bd-path.ts executable resolution with config-first then PATH lookup (bd.exe/bd.cmd/bd.bat/bd), plus actionable setup guidance when missing. Added tests/lib/bd-path.test.ts for success/failure cases.
close_reason: Executable resolution implemented with config/PATH fallback and actionable missing-bd guidance; tests added.

title: Implement mutation API for create/update/close/reopen/comment operations
description:
Mutation API contract and mapping.

Supported operations:
- create, update, close, reopen, comment

Validation:
- Payload shape validation enforces required fields and basic constraints.
- update requires at least one mutable field.
- status values are constrained to board-supported statuses.

Command mapping:
- create -> bd create <title> [flags] --json
- update -> bd update <id> [flags] --json
- close  -> bd close <id> [-r reason] --json
- reopen -> bd reopen <id> [-r reason] --json
- comment -> bd comments add <id> <text> --json

Response shape:
- { ok, operation, command, error? }
- command field always includes normalized bridge result.

Verification:
- tests/lib/mutations.test.ts and tests/api/mutations-routes.test.ts
- Runtime smoke lifecycle executed across create/update/close/reopen/comment.
acceptance_criteria:
Acceptance contract:
- Every mutation route maps to bd.exe only.
- Invalid payloads return explicit bad_args responses.
- Reopen and comment operations are first-class and tested.
notes: Implemented mutation validation/mapping/execution layer in src/lib/mutations.ts and App Router endpoints: /api/beads/create|update|close|reopen|comment. Added payload validation tests, route validation tests, and smoke-tested create/update/comment/close/reopen lifecycle via API.
close_reason: Mutation API implemented for create/update/close/reopen/comment with payload validation, command mapping, normalized error shape, and verified smoke lifecycle via API.

title: Add optimistic updates with rollback and SSE reconciliation
description:
Optimistic writeback behavior.

Frontend mutation strategy:
- Apply optimistic status update to local issue state.
- Mark issue as pending during command execution.
- On failure: rollback to previous issue snapshot and surface mutation error.
- On success: fetch authoritative issue list from /api/beads/read and replace local state.

Rationale:
- Preserves responsive UX without violating source-of-truth boundary.
- Reconciliation avoids stale local drift when external agents mutate files.

Verification:
- tests/lib/writeback.test.ts for transition planning and optimistic updater helpers.
- Runtime mutation smoke tests confirm end-to-end lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria:
Acceptance contract:
- Failed mutation restores prior local state.
- Successful mutation reconciles to authoritative read response.
- Pending state prevents repeated conflicting transitions.
notes: Implemented optimistic status updates with rollback in Kanban page, per-issue pending state, and authoritative reconciliation via new GET /api/beads/read endpoint after successful mutations.
close_reason: Optimistic board updates with rollback and authoritative post-mutation reconciliation via read route implemented and validated.

title: Implement drag-and-drop status transitions mapped to bd commands
description:
Kanban drag-and-drop transition semantics.

Transition planner rules:
- Any -> closed: use close command.
- closed -> open: use reopen command.
- closed -> in_progress|blocked|deferred: reopen then update target status.
- open|in_progress|blocked|deferred between non-closed states: update status.

UI behavior:
- Drag start attaches issue id/status metadata.
- Drop lane executes planned mutation steps in order.
- Lane card pending state is shown while mutation is in flight.

Verification:
- tests/lib/writeback.test.ts transition planning cases.
- Runtime smoke checks for close/reopen/update transition chain.
acceptance_criteria:
Acceptance contract:
- DnD invokes valid bd command sequence for each source->target status.
- Invalid/no-op transitions do not emit unnecessary commands.
- Pending safeguards prevent duplicate conflicting moves.
notes: Implemented lane drag-and-drop interactions in Kanban board, status transition planning (including closed -> reopen+update), and mapped transitions to bd mutation API routes with pending-state safeguards.
close_reason: Kanban lane drag-and-drop transitions now map to bd-backed close/reopen/update mutations with transition planner tests and runtime smoke validation.
